name: wfh town
description:
The viral case study on possibilities in collaborative design tools. It is also a cautionary and chaotic tale for why design systems are essential. 

This project has been described by the design community as nostalgic of early-internet age forums, games, and viral projects like r/place. 

This project was purely fun with no seriousness, except for the curiosity of what the design community is capable of when they work together remotely. 

Thanks to the team at Figma for hyping this up! The full twitter thread can be found here: https://twitter.com/noturswamp/status/1236004564412665856?s=20
